alert.note: Alert for Lowndes; Neshoba; Noxubee (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 14 at 3:00AM CDT until further notice by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding is ongoing due to heavy rainfall from earlier thunderstorms. * WHERE...Portions of central Mississippi, east central Mississippi and northeast Mississippi, including the following counties, in central Mississippi, Attala and Choctaw. In east central Mississippi, Kemper, Neshoba, Noxubee and Winston. In northeast Mississippi, Lowndes and Oktibbeha. * WHEN...Until 1000 AM CDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. Expect many areas of slow moving or standing water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 257 AM CDT, emergency managers reported flooding due to heavy rain caused by earlier thunderstorms in the warned area. Flooding is ongoing. Between 6 and 12 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that continue to experience flooding include... Starkville, Louisville, Macon, Ackerman, De Kalb, Brooksville, Scooba, Crawford, Shuqualak, Noxapater, Weir, Artesia, Longview, Sturgis, Mccool, Porterville, Mashulaville, Millcreek, Gholson and Betheden. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
